meanings.definition: One who couches or puts to bed.
meanings.sent1: The coucher gently tucked the child into bed.
meanings.sent2: The coucher at the daycare ensured all the kids were comfortable for nap time.
meanings.sent3: The coucher made sure the teddy bear was also tucked in for the night.
meanings.sent4: The coucher of dreams guided the children to peaceful sleep.
meanings.sent5: The coucher sang a lullaby to help the baby fall asleep.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture for reclining or sleeping on.
meanings.sent1: The cozy coucher in the living room was perfect for relaxing.
meanings.sent2: The hotel room had a comfortable coucher for guests to rest on.
meanings.sent3: The old coucher in the attic was covered in dust and memories.
meanings.sent4: The coucher by the window offered a view of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The outdoor coucher was ideal for stargazing on summer nights.

meanings.sent1: After a long day, she wanted to coucher on the sofa.
meanings.sent2: He liked to coucher on the grass and watch the clouds go by.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to coucher on the warm spot by the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The tired hiker finally had a chance to coucher under the shade of a tree.
meanings.sent5: The sunbather planned to coucher by the pool all afternoon.

meanings.sent1: The mother would coucher her baby after reading a bedtime story.
meanings.sent2: It was time to coucher the children and say goodnight.
meanings.sent3: The babysitter had to coucher the kids before the parents came home.
meanings.sent4: The nurse would coucher the patients in the hospital ward.
meanings.sent5: The shepherd would coucher the sheep in the barn at night.
